title: Federalism Versus Anarchy in the Age of Blockchain
subtitle: From Moses and the Twelve Tribes to Bitcoin City and Seasteading: Why Government Needs Blockchain and Blockchain Needs Governance
author: Rev. Ryan Sasha-Shai Van Kush / Van Kush Family Research Institute

executive_summary.key_thesis: Blockchain was built by anarchists for anarchists, but the movement has devolved into 'we made our money already' mentality. The time has come for Federalism over Anarchy - not Fox News federalism, but the original model: Moses and the Twelve Tribes.
executive_summary.core_argument: Multiple sovereign entities united under a common framework, each autonomous but part of a larger federation. This is the governance model that blockchain actually requires if it is to fulfill its potential as civilization infrastructure rather than speculative casino.
executive_summary.current_moment: El Salvador started it. Venezuela just got rid of Maduro. The moment is now. Bitcointown, Blueseed, seasteading, special economic zones, charter cities - these experiments point toward a future where blockchain-enabled governance becomes reality.
executive_summary.fundamental_tension: These experiments will only succeed if we understand the fundamental tension between anarchist origins and federalist necessity.

cypherpunk_movement.ideology: Libertarian-anarchist views about privacy, limited government, and freedom of speech
cypherpunk_movement.eric_hughes_quote: We the Cypherpunks are dedicated to building anonymous systems... privacy in an open society requires anonymous transactions.

timothy_may_crypto_anarchist_manifesto.foundation: Anarcho-capitalism: voluntary transactions and free markets, with the state entirely removed from economic life
timothy_may_crypto_anarchist_manifesto.goal: Not interested in reforming government - they wanted to make it obsolete

cypherpunk_movement.rhea_myers_quote: The thing that Bitcoin does is to make it impossible to interfere at the moment of transaction. This is a very modest achievement. There are many other things that you need to do in order to have a free society, however conceived.

genesis_block.embedded_message: The Times 03/Jan/2009 Chancellor on brink of second bailout for banks
genesis_block.significance: Bitcoin exists as an erosion of trust in centralized financial institutions and government control

satoshi_nakamoto_genesis.disappearance_ideology: Having created a self-sustaining decentralized system, the founder handed control to the community and vanished - demonstrating that the system needed no leader, no government, no central authority
satoshi_nakamoto_genesis.key_insight: The question 'who is Satoshi?' is a trap

government_problem.core_issue: The field is largely run by people who designed it specifically to exclude government participation
examples: IBM approaches government with Hyperledger Fabric
Delaware tries to put state records on blockchain
government_problem.results: The Delaware Blockchain Initiative collapsed. Government RFP projects repeatedly stall.
government_problem.frontiers_study_quote: Blockchains for crisis response remain in proof-of-concept stages... an open question is why governments have been slow to deploy it.
government_problem.cultural_gap: Blockchain developers often view government engagement with suspicion or contempt. Government officials often view blockchain developers as 'crypto bros' running speculative schemes. Neither side speaks the other's language.

true_federalism.not: Fox News federalism - the talking point about 'states' rights' that masks other agendas
true_federalism.is: The original model: Moses and the Twelve Tribes of Israel
true_federalism.israelite_innovation: Twelve tribes, each autonomous in their internal affairs. Levites governing religious law across the federation. Each tribe sovereign, but part of a larger framework that provided common identity, shared law, and collective security.
true_federalism.key_distinction: This is NOT federal government supremacy over states. This IS multiple sovereign entities united under a common framework.

foreign_prince_archetype.description: Transformative legal and governance documents have emerged from figures raised in the palace but related to outsiders. Half-blooded in the sense of having insider knowledge combined with outsider identity. Writers of competitive documents that challenge existing power structures while allowing remonstrance from those outside power.

moses.position: Raised in Pharaoh's court but related to Hebrew slaves
moses.competitive_document: Torah - a competitive document to Egyptian law

thomas_jefferson.position: Virginia aristocracy (the Randolphs) but champion of revolution
thomas_jefferson.competitive_document: Declaration of Independence - a competitive document to British law

loki.position: Raised among the Aesir gods but has Giant bloodline

foreign_prince_archetype.blockchain_application: Someone must have insider knowledge of both systems while maintaining outsider perspective on each. Someone must write competitive documents - new frameworks that challenge both anarchist absolutism and governmental overreach.

bitcoin_legal_tender.significance: First country in the world to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender
bitcoin_legal_tender.announced_by: President Nayib Bukele at Miami Bitcoin Conference
promises: Financial inclusion for 70% of Salvadorans without bank accounts

bitcoin_city.tax_structure: No income tax, no property tax, no capital gains tax - only VAT
bitcoin_city.funding: $1 billion 'Volcano Bond' through Blockstream and iFinex

results.2025_poll: 92% of Salvadorans didn't use Bitcoin at all in 2024
results.imf_rollback: Early 2025: El Salvador rolled back Bitcoin policies as condition of $1.4 billion IMF loan - businesses can now choose whether to accept Bitcoin, taxes no longer payable in cryptocurrency

blueseed.founders: Max Marty and Dario Mutabdzija (former Seasteading Institute employees)
blueseed.concept: Anchor a ship 12 nautical miles off California coast in international waters - 'Googleplex of the sea' where foreign entrepreneurs could work near Silicon Valley without US visas
blueseed.funding: Peter Thiel offered to lead seed financing round
blueseed.pitch: Social laboratory for new forms of government
blueseed.outcome: Failed to launch due to funding difficulties

blueseed_seasteading.fundamental_problem: Anarchist governance approaches require either genuinely unclaimed territory (which barely exists) or the cooperation of existing governments (which defeats the purpose). You cannot simply 'exit' to the ocean and declare sovereignty. International law, maritime treaties, and the practical need for port access all constrain supposed autonomy.

chaos: Initially stated to be on Ethereum, then changed to NEM at launch
White papers in different languages contained conflicting information
Ethereum core developer stated it 'blatantly plagiarized' from Dash's GitHub repository
US banned American transactions in Petro, describing it as 'attempt to prop up the Maduro regime'

outcome.january_2024: All Petro coins automatically converted to bolivar
outcome.creator_fate: Gabriel Jimenez forced out at gunpoint, fled to US

venezuela.lesson: State-controlled cryptocurrency without genuine decentralization is simply fiat currency with extra steps
venezuela.current_situation: Maduro's capture in January 2026 opens new phase. Question is whether incoming government will learn from Petro disaster or repeat it with different branding.

ibm_hyperledger_approach.concept: Permissioned blockchains - systems that maintain blockchain's security benefits while allowing organizational control over participation

2025_deploying_american_blockchains_act.partnerships: IBM and Avalanche to pilot GDP data on-chain

examples: Estonia: blockchain for secure health records
Walmart: Hyperledger Fabric for food traceability, reducing trace times from days to seconds
ibm_hyperledger_approach.ibm_quote: Before governments put forward legislation, decision-makers must first educate themselves about the technology

rfp_problem.government_assumptions: Technology providers are fungible and systems can be controlled

aragon_spain_example.use_case: Blockchain for public procurement vendor selection
aragon_spain_example.solution: Hybrid architecture: Ethereum public blockchain coupled with Hyperledger Fabric permissioned blockchain

cultural_gap.blockchain_developer_view: Hybrid approaches are 'not really blockchain' - a betrayal of decentralization principles
cultural_gap.government_official_view: Fully decentralized systems are unusable for public purposes
cultural_gap.result: Government blockchain projects repeatedly stall at proof-of-concept stage

what_would_moses_do.model: Sovereign entities that maintain autonomy while participating in shared infrastructure

tribes_nodes.description: Each participating entity - whether nation-state, city, corporation, or community - runs its own blockchain node with full validation capability
tribes_nodes.key_principle: No single entity can be excluded by others, but all must maintain the shared protocol

levites_validators.description: A specialized class of participants handles protocol-level governance
levites_validators.role: Not controlling transactions, but maintaining the shared rules
levites_validators.examples: Technical consortiums, standards bodies, or federated councils

the_law_protocol.description: Shared rules encoded in smart contracts
the_law_protocol.updatable: Through federated consensus rather than unilateral decree
the_law_protocol.requirement: Changes require agreement across tribes - not unanimity, but supermajority

tithing_transaction_fees.distinction: Unlike taxation (coercive) or pure market fees (chaotic), tithing creates sustainable commons through religious/cultural obligation

karma_merit_system.description: DeLaurence Karma Merit System - a reputation framework where participants earn 'grade' through service to the network and to each other

denson_v_beazley.holding: Upheld testamentary disposition based on afterlife beliefs
denson_v_beazley.quote: Judging such beliefs as 'insane delusion' would mean 'John Wesley, Martin Luther, Joan of Arc, Joseph Addison, Napoleon Bonaparte and hundreds more of the greatest and soundest minds which ever existed on earth, must be declared insane.'

united_states_v_ballard.holding: First Amendment prohibits courts from determining the truth or falsity of religious beliefs - only whether believers are sincere

karma_merit_system.constitutional_protection: A karma merit system operating through blockchain, with sincere spiritual foundations, enjoys constitutional protection
karma_merit_system.implementation: Service to others raises your grade; service only to self lowers it. This creates incentive structures aligned with federation health rather than individual extraction.

conclusion.title: The Time Is Now
conclusion.what_anarchism_achieved: The anarchist blockchain vision achieved something remarkable - it proved that decentralized consensus systems could work at scale
conclusion.current_problem: The 'we made our money already' mentality that now dominates crypto culture abandons the original promise of democratized finance
conclusion.government_struggle: Governments worldwide struggle to engage with technology explicitly designed to exclude them

federalist_third_path.not_anarchy: Which produces Silk Road and speculative bubbles
federalist_third_path.not_centralization: Which produces CBDCs and surveillance currencies
federalist_third_path.but_federation: Sovereign entities maintaining autonomy while participating in shared infrastructure, bound by common law encoded in protocol, sustained by voluntary contribution rather than coercion

geopolitical_moment: Argentina is following with Milei's reforms
conclusion.call_to_action: What's needed now is the framework - the competitive documents that Moses and Jefferson wrote for their generations

historical_synthesis.shared_insight: Sustainable civilization requires neither tyranny nor chaos, but federation - multiple sovereign entities united under common framework, each free within its domain, all participating in shared infrastructure that none can unilaterally control

conclusion.final_mission: Not to replace fiat with crypto (the anarchist dream) or to make crypto into fiat (the statist nightmare), but to build federalist blockchain systems that governments can actually use and citizens can actually trust
conclusion.author_quote: This is Federalism, the Sovereign Citizens have nothing on me because I'm a Federalist. Like a Jew in a Tribe of Jews, part of a wider Jewish Federation. Levites for example are in Charge. Hardly a Jew in the Bible believes in God, they are all Pagans in the Bible, then the Law returns again and again and God Follows.
